SENT.plain: The effect of topical recombinant interferon alfa 2c hydrogel (IFN alpha 2C) in the aphthous lesions of the mouth in Behcet's syndrome was assessed in twenty patients in a twelve-week open trial
IFN alpha 2C applied to the mouth for four weeks significantly reduced the number of aphthae in the post-treatment phase compared to the pretreatment and treatment phases
Topical IFN alpha 2C seems to be effective in the treatment of the aphthae in Behcet's syndrome
